summary:
## The Grateful Dead: A Simplified Summary

The Grateful Dead was an American rock band formed in 1965 in California. They were known for mixing many music styles and improvising during live shows. Their biggest fans were called "Deadheads."

The band started during the 1960s counterculture movement and had several founding members, including Jerry Garcia (lead guitar) and Bob Weir (rhythm guitar). They went through some lineup changes over their 30-year career.

Despite having only one big hit song, "Touch of Grey," they were very popular and influential. They were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame and are considered one of the greatest bands of all time.
title: Grateful Dead
